lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons. Before we get into it, first off I wanted to welcome back our fantastic Ashly Burch.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ashly Burch, everybody!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, hello. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's good to have you back. For those who missed the announcement on Talks Machina, she'll be joining us for the next episode as well, and for our GenCon live show.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And maybe more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll see where it goes. I don't want to take up too much of her time, but we'll see where it goes. We will at some point this evening have another guest joining us, which we'll introduce as she comes in. We have already announced her, so it doesn't matter, why am I holding it back? Sumalee Montano will be joining us, but she'll be coming in as the narrative requires. In the meantime, let's get through some announcements. First and foremost, we have our fantastic sponsor for the campaign, our friends at D&D Beyond.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond, everybody! As mentioned last week, the newly revamped digital character sheet for D&D Beyond has released. With improved desktop and tablet views, better at-a-glance information, all kinds of customization, and an updated PDF export.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm really excited about that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Dear Sam, loving D&D Beyond. Just used their easy character creator to roll a brand-new character "after my favorite PC was tragically killed last week. I'm still really sad about it, but watching "your show is taking my mind off the loss. I love how Critical Role doesn't remind me about that "death all the time." Again, these are from a few weeks ago, so I haven't--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're such an asshole.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Dear Sam, my whole campaign uses D&D Beyond, and their new shareable links really help us play "faster. Side note: I love your interactions with Taliesin in this campaign! Don't change that "dynamic, it's perfect and I can't get enough of it. Thank you."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Goddamn it, Sam. You're the worst.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Dear Sam--" These are from a couple weeks ago, that is the premise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These are the truth!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Dear Sam, just signed up for a Master-level subscription at D&D Beyond, and all their content "is so cool! I'm enclosing a photo of a tattoo I just got; it's my first and I'm very proud, as you "can see. That's Nott and Mollymauk dancing together. I know it's in cursive, so you might not "be able to read that they're both saying, 'We're going to live forever!' What do you think?" There was a picture included in that one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: For my first action I kill Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Last but not least, we got an actual letter from the D&D Beyond corporation, which also got lost and found. It says, "Dear Sam: Hey, let's refrain from anything sad or emotional in your ads "this week. We want players to associate our app with fun, not intense loss that might trigger "feelings of pain or misery. Keep it light! Do one of those dumb songs you write. Oh, and give our "love to Taliesin! He's our favorite, and he's the only reason we advertise on your show." I could not have planned it because those are from weeks ago, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love that you "lost" the printed-out, e-mail letters in our move.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone used the same paper, stock, and font.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They look really pristine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. One of them was fake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam. And thank you, our friends at D&D Beyond, and I'm sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You've got to laugh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Moving on from that, as a reminder we are heading to San Diego Comic Con, like, in a day. As well as Ashly.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going to be also at New York Comic Con in October, which we're excited about. Our Comic Con panel is this Saturday, July 21st at 6:30pm in room 6BCF. We'll air the panel next Tuesday in place of Talks Machina, so if you aren't there at the event, you'll still have a chance to see the panel next week, so look for that. The details are at CritRole.com. I will also be doing a cartoon voices panel that same day on Saturday at 1:00pm in the same room, 6BCF. Ashly, I believe you have something going on at Comic Con as well.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to be moderating the final San Diego Comic Con Adventure Time panel, because the series is ending. It will be fun, but probably sad, but fun! It'll be fun. I was told to keep it light. So I'm keeping it light. Then in the evening, I'm going to be joining the good, good boys of The Adventure Zone at their live show. So I'm getting my D&D fill.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A lot of adventure.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A lot of adventure, a lot of D&D. It's great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Give the boys our love.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently only the US and Canada, excluding Quebec, are available for those giveaways because of weird laws. Check it out. A reminder that we have our Wyrmwood giveaways during the break of Critical Role, but they are back under the Critical Role Twitch stream. When we come to the break towards the middle of the evening, we'll announce it, you move over to the Critical Role Twitch, twitch.tv/criticalrole, to be able to enter it then. Keep your eyes posted, and I will notify you as that comes about. That is all I've got as far as announcements, anyone have anything else they want to talk about?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just want to procrastinate and prolong the--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What'd you do today? What'd you eat for breakfast?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Busy day? Was it a busy day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You assume I ate breakfast. You assume I've eaten at all this week.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sure if Laura were here, she would say there are still many Nott the Best Detective Agency T-shirts in the store. Are there? I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know, I should probably--

lines.name: SAM, ASHLEY
lines.text: Laura?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, she's not here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Travis, bring me pickles!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's exactly what she'd be saying right now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh my god, that was a perfect Laura. I thought she was here!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pretty spot on. I've known her a long time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right then. That brings us into tonight's episode of Critical Role.

lines.name: LIAM, SAM
lines.text: (scatting) [click, TV static] [groovy Critical Role theme]

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: --you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (frustrated sigh) So?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is too much emotional emotional whiplash. Can you stand for the full four hours?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No! Oh god!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Metal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can see the wrinkles from where it was packaged.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You encountered an elder protector of this tribe, along with a boy who had survived this encounter, and were sent off on your way. Traveling northward on horseback, you managed to catch up and actually make ground on the Iron Shepherds. Comparing your intel, and through a few surprises as to what they were carrying, a plan was hatched to set an ambush, to halt them in their tracks, and assault them. Upon the plan taking off, things were going in your favor, but through a series of bad lucks-- A bad lucks, the plural, it's an actual English phrase.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's how bad they were.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They were bad. A series of moments of bad luck, and a too-late realization of the overwhelming power of the foe you faced, one of you fell. Mollymauk lies slain in the middle of the road at the hands of Lorenzo, the leader of the Iron Shepherds. Making an example, pushing Keg onto the ground, leaving her with the knowledge of what he perceives as her fault, to live with it; and to spread their name and the terror of what they do, and not to let anybody else get in their way. You all watched quietly, unable to really have a moment yet, to digest what has happened, as you see the carts slowly, quietly, make their way northward: out of sight beyond the hills, towards your eventual destination. And that's where we begin. There's a faint bit of snowfall that's still coming down from the clouds above you there in the valley. The flurry, the storm that has been encroaching is not that far off. You look down past the somewhat-muddy tracks of the wheels of the carts that had headed away from you, your horses still stashed alongside the outer hills in which you had set this ambush. You look down to the bloodied, still body of Mollymauk, as the snow slowly begins to fall and rest upon his form.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to give us about ten minutes to figure out what we want to do here, and then I am sending Frumpkin out after them. We need to decide something now, because I am going to be out of it for a bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau walks over to Keg, and grabs Keg by the coif, and tries to slam Keg into the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you resist?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you think that maybe telling us that Lorenzo was a high fucking magic user would have been-- Or are you still fucking working with them?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I didn't know! I'm sorry. I'm sorry, I didn't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Beauregard, she would have told us. She wouldn't have been able to hide it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where is his fucking stupid tapestry? Where is it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They are going to Shadycreek. They are probably going to take them to The Sour Nest, that's where they--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go, and I look. Is his tapestry still on her horse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the tapestry of Bahamut is still rolled up and strapped over the back of one of the horses.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're taking this back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull Keg up. This place they are going, is it permanent? Or a temporary camp, or it's been there for years and this where they always are?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's where they always are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know how far off we are from it now?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How far is Shadycreek?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About two days' travel and it's maybe a two hour journey into the forest north of Shadycreek.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go over to Molly's body.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is pointless.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? What is pointless?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I didn't even fucking know that Lorenzo could do that. You saw what he did, there's no way. It's fucked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think she's fucking right. How long have you been separated from these fucking assholes?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (long sigh) Maybe a month, I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They learned to do that in a month?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not a lot of time to--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They didn't show me much. I'm clearly not very fucking bright, so there's a lot I probably didn't pick up on, but-- I don't know. I'm realizing I don't fucking know anything about them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many people are in their camp, what did you call it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The Sour Nest is where the Iron Shepherds have camp.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But I mean, Shadycreek Run is-- It's a full city.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure. What about The Sour Nest?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I thought there were just five. I don't know who those other two were. I don't fucking know! Everything that I thought I knew about them-- I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I search Molly's body and look for the tarot cards first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easy enough to find. You have to go through a few pockets on the inside of the jacket, but you eventually find where he keeps them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Take the amulet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you have the periapt of wound closure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Toss it to Caleb.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're just going to pick his body off?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to take what his dead body isn't using any more.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But he woke up before, maybe we should leave it with him in case he needs it later.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to leave him with everything else. I don't think we should take his sword.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do we want to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, she's right, we can't fight them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Cut your losses.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not without help, anyway. Did you guys just suddenly fucking forget that they took Yasha? They took Fjord, they took Jester.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not willing to walk away from this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It would be the smarter bet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He's not wrong.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck you both.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We could live, sure, we could live. We go hide in the woods. Go back to picking pockets and pulling scams on people. You know that I want more than that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I'm not going to do that again. I'm not saying that I'm going to go off and be a fucking hero, but maybe we can equal out and I can at least not fuck any more shit up. Take baby steps towards the leaving the town better... thing. That's the least I can do for him. And I'm going to start with these fuckheads.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take you there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are we going to do first? The man crawled out of a grave once, if he's to be believed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who the fuck is Lucien?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's done it once, maybe he will do it again. Do we stay here, do we try to find, I don't-- I've read of miracles.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Look, you guys don't have a lot of time for your friends. The ones that are captured.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should bury him, and leave some sort of marker--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A note.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm assuming Shadycreek doesn't have high level priests and the Empire and churches and stuff like that. Doesn't sound like the type of place that has--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: One of the last places you'd find something like that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The only things that you would know of Shadycreek, from your experience, would be whatever miracle workers that would exist there are owned by the tribes, and weird tales of strange hermits that live in the forest beyond the city.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. But I haven't met anyone directly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not directly, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many days' travel are we from the beginning of this journey?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the beginning?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. From The Gentleman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Close to 17 or so days since you left Zadash.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are in the middle of nowhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Keg, no judgement or anything, but you sort of froze up in the little fight we had.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When you say you can take us there, are you just talking about taking us there and dropping us off?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll do what I can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do we know you won't freeze up again?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or cut and run, like you said.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The way you talk about Molly. I had a friend like that once, just one. They killed him, and I ran then, too. I left him behind: he's the reason I'm here. I didn't think I would do it again, but I did, I fucking froze up. I can't promise it, but I promise that I'll try. My life isn't shit, it's never been. It's kind of the shit about meeting people that are actually kind is that you realize what a fucking nightmare your life's been before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's funny how the good people can make assholes like us feel so small.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can get us there, though.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can get you there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It does not need to be a frontal assault, we don't need to throw our lives away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can't fight them! We can't fight them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There are people that could be swayed. But you're going to need money.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go back over to Molly's body and start finding his coin purse. He's going to sponsor his own campaign to resurrection.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, on Molly you find 173 gold pieces and 13 silver pieces amongst a cluster of other knick knacks and trinkets if you are so interested.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, want a trinket? To remember Molly by?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Molly said not to steal from happy people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that what you think I'm doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope. I think you should take everything you can, but I can't steal from this one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take the money.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't mean to rush you guys, but shit gets way worse once they get back to The Sour Nest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull out the clay cat's paw and cast Earthen Grasp and the cat's claw forms out of the dirt and I use it to start digging a hole in the earth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Near one of the hills?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. As the cat's claw starts digging down, I'm looking for-- the glaive wasn't left, right? He took it with him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he took it with him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sticks, branches, ja?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are branches to the tree that you had cut down, some of the logs that are there, there are some pieces of branch that could be utilized.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You trying to make firewood?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. I go to Molly's body and begin to get the coat off him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The claw has about a minute, so hopefully it can dig something deep enough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say given the size of the claw and its earthen attachment, it can make, in that minute that it has, a fairly functional hole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to start to pull him into the hole.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's wrap him in his cloth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a good idea. We certainly can't carry it anymore; it's very impractical.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was impractical the moment he bought it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Absolutely. It's a terrible purchase.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I step back and look away to give them privacy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys carefully and respectfully take the tapestry of the Platinum Dragon, Bahamut, and use it to wrap him comfortably, the spell ends and the hole is complete.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we leaving his swords? There's one that can teleport?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a pretty awesome sword, from what I remember.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I grab some paper out of my bag and I start writing a note to Mollymauk, telling him to find us through The Gentleman.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a good idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tell him his name, too. Or, ooh! We can make one up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Mollymauk's pretty unique and different. It's a good name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take the swords.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or, at least, is there one fancy one and one basic one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, they're both pretty fancy, but one of them is a brass, gold color. It's the one that you had found not too long ago.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's the one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Summer's Dance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we'll take that one. Summer's Dance. We'll give it back to him if he comes back to us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a loan! It's a loan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, and also, there might be grave robbers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, fuck those guys, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Looters, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take that note and I stick it into the lapel of the folds of his clothes, and I brush the hair out of his face, and then I start to push soil back over the body.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I help him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we say some words or anything?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pour a drink?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. I'll pour drinks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Long may he reign.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Long may he reign.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the best fucking shit I got.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shine bright, circus man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think you're supposed to say things about how good they were and how many people loved them, and what a wonderful life they had, but I don't think any of those things are true, or at least we don't-- I don't think he even knew.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb sighs and takes a five-foot, six-foot sturdy branch, one that could be a walking stick, and I take that stone-- that lucky rock that I found-- and I start to hammer the branch into the ground so it is sticking up like a post, and then hang Mollymauk's coat from it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That'll be stolen, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not right away. If he comes up out of the ground, it will be here waiting for him in a day or two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe you should write another note and leave it on the coat that says, "Don't fucking "steal this, you fucking looter assholes. Dead guy's buried here."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we will just leave the coat, Beauregard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like a note could be very convincing, but that's fair. All right, let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go after them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we do not have to decide what we are going to do right away. We could have an opportunity, grab our friends. We don't need to rush into the lion's den. Let's see what we are looking at, what we are dealing with. We get our three friends back. We have not traveled with them this far to throw it away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To throw what away? I want to hear you say it. Why do you want to go after them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Their deaths would be a waste.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wrong. Why?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb storms off into the woods.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keg.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: For what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we all would have been dead back there had you not made your offer, which you didn't have to do. It's noted.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A bit too little, too late, but sure, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was your friend's name?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yuto.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Deal?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Deal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you run, we'll kill you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's fair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Bad time to ask for a drink?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never a bad time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You deserve it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you've stormed off, a bit around the way to the little bit of scrub and a few trees off to the side, where the horses are set. There's a new horse standing there, one that wasn't with the rest of your trio.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a spy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Medium brown in color.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cooing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm in the open right now with the horses, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It's looking right at you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The horse is? There's no person around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No other person that you see, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk up to the front of the horse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It clomps up, meeting your step with each step you take.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. Who are you, Freund?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You said "Sumalee," not "So Molly," right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's so Molly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hi, welcome!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hi, Sumalee!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow! You have to do a Mr. Ed voice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make sure you scoot in enough for the camera, there.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're jumping in a bouncy funhouse over here! We're having a grand old time!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, it's just been a laugh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just so great!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you'd like to describe what Caleb sees as the horse is no more, and there's now a person standing before him.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: My ears are soft, and floppy. I stand tall, strong. My shoulders droop a little forward. I'm looking with big, round eyes at all of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, that's a pretty good trick.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're out for a stroll?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I've been watching you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, gut. How long have you-- You are very tall.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Not for my clan. I am just average.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja. Okay. Did you see everything that happened in here in the last 20 minutes or so?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I am sorry for your loss.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey guys, we have a visitor!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought you were talking to yourself again.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What kind of visitor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance over and you see the extremely tall female form of this firbolg; humanoid with a face that comes to a deer-like shape to the front, floppy ears, looming over, looking right at Caleb, who's taking a step back and looking up towards her.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Um.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Hello.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You all right, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I just was not expe-- you know, we've been through-- It's been a long day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you're not like a shared hallucination, right?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No, I assure you, I am not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't have any holy abilities, by any chance?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I do not know this word "holy," but I have abilities, which I might like to share with you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Should we go dig him up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you bring dead people back to life?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No, I'm sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a stupid question from me, I apologize.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was worth a shot, right? I mean. You would have kicked yourself if you hadn't asked and later she was like, "Oh yeah, by the way."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She probably would have offered though, you know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We ran into a tribe on the way here, you wouldn't happen to know an older woman named Jumnda would you?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes. She is my elder.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They all know each other, I knew it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, that's--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know Pumat Sol?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughing) You're terrible.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: What did Jumnda say?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She said a strong woman on a mission to go find her son, part of her clan, was heading north. Would you happen to be Nila? Or is it Ny-la? Am I pronouncing that right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was Nila.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was Nila? Nila.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: You had it right the first time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nailed it.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I am Nila. It is nice to meet you all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's nice to meet you too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's nice to meet you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We met your friends. Family? Tribe? Clan?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They told us that you're trying to find the same people we are. I think? You're trying to find these folks who kidnapped someone who you know?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I wasn't sure if I could trust you, but seeing as how I saw what you went through, I could use a little help too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, how are you feeling about your chances now, after watching the bloodbath?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I think I might have some abilities that can help, but I knew I could not do it alone, and I saw you have abilities, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: On our good days.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What abilities are you talking about?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She was a horse a moment ago.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?! You buried the lede there, Caleb! (laughter)

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Did you not get that?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No! I thought Caleb-- I mean, he kind of talks to himself.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Right. I forgot. I was a horse.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we have an extra horse!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can make other animal shapes, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! Caleb can turn his cat into a bird!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is a little trick. Can you turn yourself into anything dangerous?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I think the most dangerous I can be is a crocodile.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's pretty dangerous.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We fought those. One almost killed me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Not the same crocodile, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was it you?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No! I never leave. This is the first time I've left my family.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have you ever been in a fight?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Not really.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, great.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: But I have other abilities that I might be able to use to help! There's one in particular that I want to use against these evil people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can curse in front of us if you need to, I mean.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: What is this "cursing?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think you'll pick it up if you hang around us for more than an afternoon.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Anyway, I have some abilities that I'd like to use on these bad people.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Killing abilities?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are you willing to kill?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can you say the word "fuck" for me?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I do not know what it means, but "fuck."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Great, all right. Well, she's got a little bit of edge.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like her. I like her a lot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hardcore.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: You do not understand what they did to my family. I am ready now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Please tell us. I mean, if it's not horribly awful to tell.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I just want to say that I'm ready. I'm ready to do things that I've never done before. To use my abilities to get my son back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Son?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know I'm the proven coward of this group, but do we want an untested horse-person coming with us?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Why would you not?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You saw the fight, right, lady?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes. I can help.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's up to you guys. It's your funeral.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your son has been captured?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: And my partner. Jumnda, the lady you ran into, my elder, she told me not to come, not to leave. "Accept nature's fate," she said. But I cannot. I have been kind and peaceful and to myself many years. No more. You need me and I cannot do this alone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Need you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's kind of right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, over there is a tree stump on the side of the road. That's the bald one. What do you do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Show us.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I will tell you because I cannot do it all the time, but when I am ready, I will summon lightning from the sky and fry him, destroy him! And I can do it again and again and again!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That sounds good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That sounds great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'd appreciate that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So moving?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What time of the day is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's early morning.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Metal o'clock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The fight was in the early morning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The fight was right at dawn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's maybe an hour after sunrise at this point, and the sky is still mostly clouded and becoming lighter. The flurry is coming closer, there is a gentle snowfall coming down at this early hour.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can do the lightning trick any time of day.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's good to know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, good for me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you drink? Alcohol? Booze?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Sometimes I taste that, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, more for us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Better not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I borrow your flask, please?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, sure, here.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: So we will join together.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you're going after your son, I trust you 100%. What was his name?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Asar.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How old is your boy?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: He's only five.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe that's fully grown for a firbolg?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. It was worth a shot.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Good thinking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. We should keep heading on to Shadycreek then.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, we should.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Anything else you want to, I don't know, do for your friend?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Your friend is here. He has not left.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That is very lovely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I'm going to go start mounting up the horses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather the last of your things, retrieve the horses, and head out.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll lead the horses, since I know where I'm going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we have three horses-- oh wait, you had one too. Wait, did you? No, you were on foot. We had three left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you had three left after the previous battle.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have to ride on one by myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. You guys can double up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it was you two doubled up and I had one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You are probably going to have to share-- Do you have a horse?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can be a horse.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you are a horse! Of course.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can turn into a horse once more. But if I do, I think that is the last time I can do it today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Until you take a rest.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Until my next rest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Horse nap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys gather up onto your horses, Keg takes the lead and you all begin your trek northward once more. Both memory of Mollymauk behind you on one shoulder, and the image of the face of your vengeance before you. You continue on your journey for the next hour or so before you catch a glance, Keg, at the road above. You see three shapes in the road.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I perception check it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13? You get a little closer and you look and it looks to be three figures that are left in the road. People left in the road.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Dead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not moving.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Guys, there's something in the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, fuck.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can't tell if they are dead from here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I send Frumpkin up into the air as an owl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Swoops down and does a few loops over it and within a moment of scanning, can see it is three bodies. A human man appears to be in his forties, a younger half-elven man in his twenties, and a young human woman, probably in her twenties, early thirties or so. They are all slain, but there is no sign of traumatic wounds or any damage to their body, though they are damp.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Damp?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damp.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it snowing-- Is there snow on the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is snow on the ground. You can see there's bits that are gathered on them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why would they just be left in the road?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb has told us all of this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am going to scout up ahead and see if I recognize them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make a medicine check for one thing as you glance at the bodies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 12, plus zero.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not too bad. You recognize the man as the one you saw in the cage before you, and at a quick glance you can see elements of flash frostbite on parts of their skin. You gather they are probably the ones that were in the cage in front of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like they tried to escape the cage?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They were dead when the frost blast hit everybody.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then they dumped the bodies.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well given that he left them in the middle of the road-- think this is his second warning? Third? Fourth?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or maybe he just wanted to move fast without extra weight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think he just cares that little for human life.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we'll cut out their tongues for food and then bury them?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nott, with the fucking tongues again, my man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What, it's protein.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Look, I know you're weird, but if you could tone it down just a skosh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't have to watch.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll hear it. You're so loud.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm pulling the first of the three off the road to the side.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I help.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to pull the bodies off the road into the grasses on the side.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do know, Keg, looking at the road, you're about at the point where you diverge from the path to follow up the road but continue on to Nogvurot, but to head to the Quannah Breach, and eventually Shadycreek Run, is due north from where you stand.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I know of any ways to not go through the front gates? Is there any sort of circumventing I could do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, not without adding another week or so travel through the mountains.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ugh, okay. Never mind, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's possible, but it's a treacherous journey to move through the Dunrock Mountains to get there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When we arrive, they may have left word to look out for us. They know what we look like. We should have some sort of disguise. I know that you and I can disguise ourselves. You can--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Beau and I are SOL.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I have my cool reversible cloak.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can make you disappear for a while.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That would probably be good. How long?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: One hour.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How long does it take to get to Shadycreek?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From where you are now, it's a little under two days travel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When we get to the gates, we could maybe just--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Slip in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do know that just beyond the Breach, there is a gate that is guarded by one of the families of the tribes. There is a toll that's taken as you pass through.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. That would probably be a good idea.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can do that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For you, we'll find a fake mustache or something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you able to do just one person?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No, I think I'm able to do--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you do the whole group?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes, I can, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Right, God? (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it Pass Without a Trace you're looking at?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That can help them hide if they want.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, so as long as we stay within 30 feet of you, we get plus ten to our stealth bonus, which would be very helpful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't turn invisible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If anybody wants to hide, it does help out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You guys could hide under the horses or something.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's badass. I like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually the light of the sky begins to grow dim as the evening calls to you, at which point the flurry has come. The snow begins to get heavier, the darkness is darker than normal at dusk and the air gets bitter cold. What do you wish to do to set camp?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we still have the tents? Did we keep the tents? We have the tents.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've taken everything, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I see through the dark with my night vision?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see up to a 60-foot distance I believe, and it's a dim light.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are there any structures around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pretty decent. The hills here-- you don't see any structures per se, but if you take a moment to walk around, you do see one hill that has a bank that is eroded, and there is a bit of an outcropping that may be about three or four feet outward. If you were to all crowd in, it might be able to prevent piercing wind and/or continuous snowfall, but it would be pretty cozy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you guys feel like cuddling?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Share body heat, keeps us warmer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ugh.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll keep watch. I'm kind of wide, so you'll have more room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Let's cuddle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys gather up here on the underside of this outcropping of the hill. Who's taking first watch? You, Keg? Make a perception check for your watch, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau tries to get a spot next to Nila because she's large and fuzzy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking out towards the distance, as everyone else is silently sleeping in a cuddled, spoon-like position at times, you glance out and see a few shapes moving past. You see a few stars blink out as shadows move past. You quietly lean forward and begin to inspect and your eyes focus at the outset of your darkvision. You notice a small set of goats that are roving the plain, making their way. The snow is falling and they're trying to find themselves to warmer climate.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Were-goats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't find any other threat or anything during your watch. Next watch?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau, make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everything seems pretty kosher.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm a little zoned out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: During your watch is when the heavy part of the storm begins to hit. No thunder. It's just very cold and you can see your breath, and you're having to involuntarily shiver as the cold kicks in. You can see now the snow piling up and you're thankful, at this moment, that you found this outcropping in Keg's vision, because the distant hills that are open are now heavily piling with this soft, powdered snow. It's starting to fall and the wind is pushing through and some of it's hitting the left side of your face. It's starting to go a little numb and you have to brush it off every now and then and try to do your best to dry up the biting cold water that is melting against your cheek. Nevertheless, your watch comes to an end without an issue. Who wants to take the final watch?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You and me, goblina.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check for me, please?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy. Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you're lucky, because nothing of note happens during your watch. You are nervously keeping your eyes out, just in case, waiting for another reverse ambush, but nothing seems to catch your attention. As the morning comes to, because you guys managed to cuddle, I would like you all to make a constitution saving throw with advantage, please.

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Cuddle-vantage!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, both terrible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I rolled a two and a two, so four.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this a saving throw or just a check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Constitution saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just laying that out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say the winter clothes and the closeness of the group-- sure. I'll say you've avoided, in your hearty goblin form-- You're used to rough weather, anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sam, you're bonier than Gollum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keg, in full metal armor, not so much.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I add my modifier though, yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do add your modifier.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Then it's actually 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're fine. You shrug it off without issue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, your warm coat keeps you warm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hearty German living.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly. You're used to these Zemnian nights.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's enough to withstand it, not a problem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While the forest definitely keeps insulation to the storm, your body is well suited for extreme weather as well. Actually-- tricksy winter clothes, but you got it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, you can--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you got them for a reason. That's what they're there for. Because of the body heat and everything, I'll allow it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're like the little kid in A Christmas Story, "I can't put my arms down!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So cute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like a spiral fracture of a bone, where suddenly what was once a solid mountain range seems to have torn and sundered into two separate ravines that seem to share a similar shape. This you recognize as the Quannah Breach. You guys begin to approach, by mid to late afternoon, the front of the breach, where you can see six crownsguard in a small outpost built at the base of the Quannah Breach. These, as you know, are usually folks that essentially warn people from traveling into the Breach, and if they do, let them know that any return is going to be probably highly searched and highly inquired. They enforce it, unless you slip them some coin. Then it's not an issue on the way back. They're more there to make money.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: For appearances, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approach, familiar to you, a crownsguard begins to put a hand up to the approaching horses and say, "Hail!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, goddamn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Where are you traveling to?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shadycreek.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You have business in these cursed lands?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, we're trying to get fucked. Can we move along?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, your life is your own, as is your business, but you must understand that coming back "is no easy task. A thorough search and inquiry into your person will be required--"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, blah, blah, blah. Can I give you a couple of coins and you let us on our way, please?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well." How much do you give him?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How little will he take?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Customary to your experience and the times that you've traveled with the Iron Shepherds, it's usually about two gold to just pass.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes it and quietly lets you pass. Per person.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Molly would want us to do this trip, maybe Molly should pay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, Molly pays the toll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you, Molly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two, four, six, eight, ten. Love you, Taliesin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, eight, because she pays herself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, Molly wouldn't want to pay for Keg.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: As he shouldn't.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I have gold pieces I can use later, too, if you want them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're not going to want to spend any of that in Shadycreek Run. There's nothing there for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why, they don't take money? Oh.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's just not a nice place.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When you're home with your people, are you one of the nicer ones, or are you a bad girl at home? What's your-- how does it--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I don't know. I am one of the ones that-- not too many people rely on me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They don't rely on you?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: More capable. Eventually I grew to accept being myself, and I prefer to support rather than be a leader. This is my first time trying to be more than who I am.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Keg does one of these to her in support.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I do not know what that is, but I like it. And I heard you use the word "fuck" again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're certainly going to rely on you.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: That makes me happy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It'll be a good test run, at least, for you. Then you can go back to your tribe and be like, "Yo, people relied on me!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: "It was dope!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "It was great, you should rely on me more!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: "It was super tight!"

lines.name: MARISHA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. They probably won't sound like that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I kick my horse along.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It feels like a giant had grabbed a mountain range and tore it in two and there's an even break on each side. It winds and curves. It's like a natural labyrinth. A few miles through this strange maze, you're met with a makeshift wall and a ten-foot wooden gate. Your eyes, at first, notice a few dozen wooden poles carved into spikes that emerge from the ground, pointed in your direction from the base, many of which are stained dark while others still bear the weathered skulls of warning. Three armored folk stand there; two human men and a half-orc woman all bearing weapons and watching you carefully as you approach.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This isn't the gate, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the gate.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've reached the edge of the Quannah Breach and turned to the final bastion outside of the Empire.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But it's not the gate into Shadycreek Run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the gate into the region of Shadycreek Run.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is the gate we need to hide in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But they see us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, they've noticed you begin to turn and approach--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Quick, hide! Hide, quick!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would know this is coming because you've traveled this before.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, so we wouldn't have turned the corner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm describing it as you-- or you're describing it as you're about to turn the corner.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Rewind the tape just a little bit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (rewinds) So!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So that's just literally around this corner?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just right around-- If we went even just a few feet that way, whoo whee! Guards, big old gate. It would have been-- oh, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We were going at a pretty good pace there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You guys are lucky that I stopped just a few feet right before we would have all seen the gate. You're welcome. You know, I'm really earning my keep here. So!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So hide! Or something, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The plan was you guys can make yourselves look different?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Then you're going to make us invisible and then you're going to be a horse?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can do that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys are going to have three horses and then two riders.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do we have stuff to put on the third horse to make it look like a pack?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. We could just take everything off our horses and gather it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll hide under the horse like Indiana Jones-style, basically? Holding on underneath? Okay, that's going to take some grip strength, but I'm into it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait! Maybe if one of our horses is a pack horse, you could be on top of the horse wrapped in a blanket or something. You're part of the gear that the horse is carrying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they search you on the way in?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do they search us on the way in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Depends on if you pay them on the way through.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We'll have to pay them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can pay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. I think this one's a little bit more expensive, though. Isn't it? Probably. The deeper we get in? Or is it the same?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the gate run by the Uteloch family of the tribes and they enforce it both as a means of making money and to know who's coming and going.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Mm-hmm. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's an equal price to what you were paying previously.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We should definitely pay it, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which plan do we want? You hiding under the horses or you hiding on the horse as suitcases?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can hide under the horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll hide as suitcase. I'll be a bundle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We lie you over the horse and we put a bunch of shit on top of you, yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Invisible or--?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: More stealthy.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: You are invisible to people. To others.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I believe that.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: You don't have to change shape.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It might be helpful so there's not--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can make us totally invisible.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I think so!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You give us a bonus to our stealth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ask your god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You cannot.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Aw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But what you can do, it's still useful here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it makes us more hideable.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If the people who are hiding try to look like-- covered in cloth and shit and try to look like cloth--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It'll pass.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can make it more believable.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know the blanket in Lord of the Rings?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The cloak--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: On the raft.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like that.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Got it. I will turn the blankets into--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rocky things. Sounds good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This whole pow wow was happening around the bend.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Guards are like--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Wait, what happens after we get through, though?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then we can do whatever we want.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, we keep going for a while--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It will be a little bit of a ride.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keep up appearances. Yeah? You're going carry these two. They're both going to lie on top of your horseback.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can't be on a horse. Just me. I'm too heavy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Too heavy?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll break her. Right? Because I can't--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A single horse you can do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A single horse I could be on. It couldn't be me and Beau. Or me and one of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's like all sticks, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With Beau it's possible. Not at a full run, but at a travel journey, you could probably do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or I could be a pack on one of your guys' horse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She could be on our horse.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because you and I are skin and bones.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll be on top of you, if that's okay.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: That's fine.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: And I will make you Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's almost like you're stepping through moonlight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Almost like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, meaning like looking at those of you in the radius, it's like it's nighttime where you're standing. The shadows are heavier. The blacks are crushed.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We've both got stuff on top of us to make us look like--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mm-hmm. I'm wrapped in a bedroll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja I mutter a few words and suddenly look like an old coot with a band of hair around the sides and my jaw is off to the side a bit and it's missing a few teeth and very squinty. That's me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like Robert Duvall, good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will mutter a few words and turn into--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What was this drawing back here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, which one?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Penis man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stop the game! What's the drawing? Hold it up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, out of character. Excuse me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's see!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was a me and Laura collab.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Somebody was talking, having a moment. Then you draw a dick man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll make myself look like Rissa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, perfect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because I know that one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Rissa and Robert Duvall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those of you who are trying to be inconspicuous, which would be Beau and Keg, go ahead and make general stealth checks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus ten, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Come on, baby. That's not great. Nine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Add ten to your roll your plus stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is what the spell does.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not good for me either. 21 with the buff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank god for the buff.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Woo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you guys turn the corner, you now see the gate and the spikes and the warning skulls and everything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not as good as you described it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know a lot of adjectives. I'm not a great storyteller. I said it's a gate and there are people there. What else do you need to know? You need the fucking colors and the designs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You had smells and you had shapes and everything, but this is--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shut the fuck up!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approach, the half-orc steps forward and goes, "Hey, you! Where you headed today?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shadycreek Run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you pass through the breach, you pay the toll."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, we have that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. Pay up."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Two gold each."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh yeah. Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got this one. Here you go, four from me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to the Greying Wildlands.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Greying Wildlands.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything you wish to do before you head to the city proper?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're still obscured, Beau and I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Obscured in the sense that you're inconspicuous in dress.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Right, but that's still happening? That spell is for an hour? Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you have any place where we can lay up?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There is this place called the Plaza Emporium. A pleasant but can be murderous dragonborn runs that. She's not affiliated with any of the unseemly folks directly, so she's a bit more neutral. We might be able to get information from her.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does she murder everybody or does--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We might want to cover Nila's eyes. It's run by the Marduns, who happen to be--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's who we're looking for.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And they are the rival family of the folks that employ the Iron Shepherds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That seems like where we should go, because the Iron Sheps won't be there to poke around and find us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is the name of that place again?

lines.name: ASHLEY, LIAM, SAM
lines.text: The Landlocked Lady.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The proprietor is kind of a skeeze ball, as you would imagine. Not necessarily the most trustworthy guy, but it is run by the Marduns. So of the safe places in the town, that's probably up there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you still laying across the back of a horse or have you pulled yourself up?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's just my face with a cigarette still.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This little--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Our horse is smoking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Amazing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I vote Landlocked Lady.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (muffled) I agree.

lines.name: SAM, MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lead us there with smoke signals.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ragged peasants clutter the alleyways, looking your way with hands extended for some sort of alms they're hoping to find.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (spits)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ugh, gross.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An emaciated dog growls at you from a nearby doorstep and then darts off down the road behind where you passed. A wagon appears stuck in the mud as you pass it, rough-looking folk tugging at it and stopping to stare you down as you slowly move past. They continue their work. You nearly step over someone with your horse who appears to be passed out, face down in a patch of dirty snow. A bit of crimson rests at their side. They're not moving. As you circle around them you watch as two rough-looking fellows in hide clad armor come and inspect him. As you glance over your shoulder, you watch as they rummage through his pockets, lift up his not moving body and dump him in one of the nearby alleys and keep on walking. You see no Crownsguard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know these to be Taskers. You're heading towards The Landlocked Lady? Easy to see. On the eastern side of this plaza, there is a very beautiful, two story complex, that comparably seems ostentatious against the buildings immediately to the right and left of it which look to be in serious disrepair and rather rundown and colorless. Just bland woods, gray and brown. Here you can see the second story above the main archway, a curved top arch, there is a false bow of a ship that is emerging outward. This beautifully carved mermaid in the front that is clutching the piercing front of the ship. There it rests with a sign dangling from it, saying The Landlocked Lady.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I totally get the name of the place now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a consistent brand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's very clever.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In Zadash, it would look like shit, but here it's the belle of the ball.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Comparably, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It seems that they don't have a strong housing code. They can get away with these more unique builds. It's very fascinating.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, it's really interesting architecture.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like Shanghai, China; everything looks different.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How far away are the Taskers? Did we just pass by them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Almost everyone here is armed, even on a scale of poverty there seems to be a general sense of needing protection amongst the chaos. Some folks look like they're trying not to be seen, many parade their thickened arms. You see one female, privateer looking individual, that comes through the streets and spits on somebody who's huddled by one of the stumps. Growls at them before continuing to walk on. It's a very unique and curious motley group of people that call this place home.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If I talk to them will I be heard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you talk to--?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If I talk to the crew?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No one's close enough to you, you think, if you're quiet enough.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I point out the Tasker tower behind us and I say: Those are the Taskers. Those are probably the only other people in this shithole that might be of use.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of use? They're good guys?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: As much as anyone's a good guy here. They try not to get-- they try to prevent the innocent from getting killed or fucked over. Obviously, they're not particularly successful, but they're not under the thumb of any particular group.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they altruists though or are they mercenaries?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's altruistic, strangely. I kind of forgot about them because we always thought they were nerds. But now I'm trying to be a little bit better. They might be helpful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do they have a uniform, or how do you know them? How do you know who they are, how can you identify them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no built uniform. What you're used to seeing with Crownsguard, and any other royal military where things are built with fine craftsmanship, everything here is put together and slapdash. That one uniform mark is usually the chain shirt and the one blue shoulder armor. Some people paint it completely, some put a line on it and leave it there like a, "Fuck you, I'm not going to finish it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're like Hell's Angels.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of. For the most part, they're keeping an eye out in the sense that they don't want complete anarchy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They still want money for their services, but they're slightly less assholeish than the most.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not going to stop someone from spitting on a peasant, but if all of a sudden a giant riot breaks out, they will break it up and beat everybody up till it stops.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's kind of cool.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Closest thing to law that exists here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, thank you. (louder) Thank you, horse, for riding us this far!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can't say anything, right, in my horse form? I can nod.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (horse huffing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've seen it argued back and forth, and I'm pretty sure when we had you in your elemental form last campaign, people were saying that you could still technically talk in that form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but I didn't talk as animals. I wasn't talking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right. You're unable to actually speak in the animal form, but you can still communicate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As elementals I was like: Run! Jump! Oh shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I reverted, that's all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keg, if we find an alleyway to drop you out of sight of you suddenly appearing, can you walk around this town, or is that dangerous?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: In some places it's dangerous. There's a place called The Trench that the Iron Shepherds in this area always hang out in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Trench?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The Trench. It's in this area. It's not a huge place, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a fairly decent sized tavern. It's one of the more populated areas.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's where they hang out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Every now and then.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How stupid is it for you to walk up on open road in this place?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think it's probably best for me not to be.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go in the brothel. We're here, right? We can stay here, or we go in here? Do I have to fuck somebody in there?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why are you worried about this? They would be worried about having to fuck you, my man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm a lady.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: My lady. I call everyone my man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But yes, you're right. You're right, that's a fair point.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If any of the Marduns are there, we might be able to-- to be honest guys, there's not a lot of options, but we might be able to get some help from them. I don't know for sure. In any case, it's a place to regroup. This brothel is not in the business of spilling everybody's secrets out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, one second, though. Which way from here are these Iron Chefs located?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're north of this, yes, Matt? The Sour Nest is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Sour Nest is northeast of where you are in the city. It's beyond this city, into the actual Savalierwood. About maybe two hours' travel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Two hours' travel?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's their headquarters, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beyond the city. The northern half of the city is almost entirely within the forest itself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. In that direction?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's in the walls of the city, or in city limits?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, The Sour Nest is beyond the city. It's its own little stronghold that exists separate from the city itself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you describe to me what it looks like? Is it noticeable?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: God? What does it look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey, you're in a town.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah! The caravan just came by.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [clomping]

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love it! It's so good.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's up to you. We can go up there now if you want.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I do not want to go up there now. I was thinking of maybe sending my cat, but that can wait. Let's go into this place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it safe for me and Keg to hop out without it looking shifty?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is an alley off to the side that if you wait for a moment for nobody watching, you guys would be able to step out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have the opportunity to revert, if you wish.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I actually feel safer in my animal form in this crazy place.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to-- (shouting) You're going to stay in the alley while we go inside?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think horses have regular hearing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope. They're mostly deaf.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I will shift back to my regular self. You make a good point, but this place is not making Nila happy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I apologize in advance for all the shit you're about to see. I open the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys hitch the horses to one of the hitching post off to the side, you make your way into the brothel. And that's where we're going to take a break.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Phew. Nila's like: Thank god! Let me regroup!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any more than that and you're disqualified from the giveaway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Forever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Chandra will whisper you and get your information and get that sent out to you. Well done. Getting us back in. As you guys step through the archway, the double doors opening as Keg pushes and leads you inside. The first thing that hits you is a fresh smell of lavender, a vanilla incense that strikes your senses, stinging your eyes with its potency.
