On the inside, you can see a handful of round tables of which two patrons are currently eating a meal that has been placed before them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I really thought you were going to say something else.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eating a dead body.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everything seems to have been here for a while or seems to have been weathered through travel or use. The immediate shine begins to fade as you begin to see how much of this is probably a fair amount of work to keep the upkeep of the facade of luxury. To the left of you, you can see a carved window-like bar or a desk and there behind it you can see a human man, probably in his late 30s. His hair, very short, and the male pattern baldness is just starting to set in. You can see a bit of the shine of the back of his head begin to poke through. He has a very well kept handlebar mustache that curves out very wide to each side of his face, and a pointed Van Dyke matching beard point that comes to the bottom. He has a vest over a light green billowing shirt that has a wide collar that curves out to the sides. As you enter and take in, he immediately glances over to meet your gaze and goes, "Why hello everyone, glad you "could make it. Welcome! Welcome to the Landlocked Lady. How could I be of service? Oh, you are a big one!"

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wonderful, are you looking for work?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, she's not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you seeking?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll need all of that above and a little bit more.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I mean not the companionship.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've had a hard week

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What were you saying?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Champ, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes? Do I know you?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Champ?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Champ? His name's Champ!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe? His name's Champ. Told you it was a shitter! Yeah, you might know me. Hey, are your bosses around bosses around by any chance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My bosses?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The people that actually own this place, I know you like to pretend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you referring to--?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The Marduns.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are at the Estate Sybaritic."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's their estate, its where they live."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sybaritic?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sitaritic?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sybaritic.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I know where that is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've passed by it, you've never been there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is it an insight to see if he's lying?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you may.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck! Critical one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's a shifty motherfucker, and you're not entirely certain he's telling the truth or not, but seems honest enough. "Lord Anselm does pass through on occasion, but he's not here today. The "rest of them I'm sure are busy with their own business, but if I see any of them, I could ask, "see if they're being summoned by-- what is your name?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's, um--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Mighty Nein?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm trying to come up with a fake name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Rick.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nailed it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Rick is my name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Really? You're not going to let that slide? 19!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Rick it is!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 19, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Rick? Very well. I'll make a note. If this is pressing business, you are more than welcome to "attempt to summon them at the estate, as I know not how often they pass through, but in the "meantime, you said you wished rooms and company?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, we'll need rooms for sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How many?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Give us a second there, Champ. I don't really feel like I want to stay around this guy that much longer. Do you guys want to go to this estate, or do you want to stay here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The estate? What would we do there?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I do not like this man.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, that makes two of us, Nila. I don't know; that's where the Marduns are. You were looking for them anyway, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All the information that you have from The Gentleman is that an individual named Ophelia Mardun, who is a friend of his, he sent you up to give her aid with a problem that she's having.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't know if she's on the outs with her family, if they're the ones who had her killed or kidnapped. We don't know anything. We'd be marching into a big question mark.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we'll get lucky, and the problem she wants help with is the Iron Shepherds. Two birds with one stone, we win. Still going along with that plan.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs) The plan has not changed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Has not changed.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's the same plan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Molly problem was a hiccup. Seems kind of cold. Anyway.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're working on it.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I have something I'd like to do now. In these moments, I have a little bag of treasures that I smell. They're little treasures that I collect along the way of things that are significant and meaningful to me. If I smell it, it tells me what the experience will be like. If we leave this man and go to this Ophelia Mardun, let me see what my smell check does. Okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like telling a fortune, but with smelling things. All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's pretty crazy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is she just getting high?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She might be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nila pulls up this small pouch with a leather flap on the front, and pulling it open there is, within a moment, a pungent smell that is a mixture of earthy, almost mossy scents, mixed with spice, mixed with rotted vegetation, mixed with a bad cheese. It's a plethora of smells, and they come in waves. She buries her nose into this for a second and takes a huge (sniffing).

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Do I know what I sense, or will you tell me what I sense?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a wisdom check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is what she does in brothels?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know if she knows what a brothel is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Add your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: 17. Oh no, wait. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The smell comes into you, and amongst the barrage of various smells, you catch a rosy, sweet smell that cuts through the rest.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes. We should go to see this Ophelia. It will be a good outcome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have had a lot of luck predicting things with this stink pouch?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh, yes. It is not stinky, though. You may smell it, if you wish.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do I smell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a wisdom check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that's pretty good. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get a faint whiff of sawdust that quickly shifts into a very old, molded, after a rain leather.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, well, yes, I'm convinced. We should definitely just march up to the estate.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, I want a hit! It's not going to go well.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I did not know that this works for others.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh yeah, it's a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you get close--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (fart noise)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't even get that close to it. You have a fairly strong sense of smell, and while some smells in your experiences of the world have put you aback, you can't even describe this odorous musk that hits your nostrils, causing your entire face to wrinkle and recoil.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Never mind, I was wrong! We shouldn't go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Champ, who has leaned forward, watching this, goes, "Out of my "curiosity, I'm now invested. Might I have a sniff as well?" (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone's sniffing your bag!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It is filled with so many wonderful things. I promise you. Wait a minute. I do not want him to smell this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She doesn't want you to smell her bag.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I didn't want a piece of the stink pouch anyway."

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's something you have to earn. Maybe tomorrow.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Wait, let me smell. Oh, all right. Here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sniffs) "No, no. Lesson learned." His eyes start watering. "Would you like a room for the "night? What are your preferences?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we should get a room or two. That way, if everything goes wrong, if we're indeed going to go to this estate, then we could at least have somewhere to crash.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I must warn you, if it's more to a room and you require a companion, the group rates are a bit "more expensive."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He means slumber parties. If we all want to have a nice rest together, just sleeping, it's more money.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: We have that in my clan, too. We all set up a huge nest of leaves and sleep together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you sure you're not looking for work?"

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we shouldn't stay here. What time of day is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, it's almost dusk. You guys have traveled the better part of your second day to even get here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't we spend a night here? You were looking for some companionship. You can work on that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can ask around. Maybe the clientele might know some things about the Sheps.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's not a bad idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, we can talk to the clientele. Maybe you should hang back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think I fit in in this town, but they might recognize me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How do you mean?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To be fair, this isn't The Iron Shepherds' hideout, we said, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's outside of the city, into the woods.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seems like they wouldn't come here. Rival family.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is it safe to say that they keep to themselves?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the most part, yeah. They only come into town to occasionally drink and essentially parade dominance. Every now and then checking in to assert their reputation, and if they have to do other bits of dirty work. They are slavers by normal trade, but they do other things for the Jagentoths, if need be.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They wouldn't feel it necessary to tell anyone else about us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not entirely certain. It depends on if they assume they're being chased, or they feel like the demonstration was enough, but you don't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spend the night here, then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I think so. We've been traveling all day. We stay here, we get up. We don't know anything about where the Shepherds-- We know nothing about their stronghold, just what you're able to tell us, but that doesn't tell us how many people are there now, what we are going to be up against. We talk to the Marduns tomorrow, figure out the next step from there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's formulate a plan in the morning. I can't think right now. I'm a little out of it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right. Champ, she sleeps alone. No funny business, all right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course not. I have a business to run."

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take a room for myself, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. For a singular room rate for the night, that will be one gold, five silver."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I arrange for companionship and drinks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Any preference of companion? We have a spectrum to choose from."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It feels weird going and picking someone out. That feels dirty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Would you prefer it a surprise?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Just make her hot, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Her. That is a preference. Very well." Goes and writes something down. "Can be done. For a "night's companionship, do you wish just for an evening's stay, or for the night over?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, just an hour, and then I want to be alone, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That will be an additional five gold pieces.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Then I get really drunk, and I go to my room for the night. Send up booze.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "An additional five silver. Just racking up the tab, then." The rest of you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll have a room by ourselves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The four of you?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, no, I mean--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I don't mind staying with you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, we're fine, just sleeping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well, suit yourself, but I'll be here for most of the night, if you change your mind."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Unless-- No judgment if you want to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, we have been together a long time, so we're used to--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, you're together.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not like that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh. Okay. I was going to say I think you could do better, but anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know if that was called for at all.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, you're absolutely right. He is handsome, and he could do much better than a little freakshow like me. He could meet any girl in town and sweep her off her feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shush. This one and myself will take one room.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll go with Nila, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Two per room, that's two gold for the group rate, so four gold for the two "additional rooms, please."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will handle the two gold for Nott and myself.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll do the two gold for us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right." He gives a key to each of you for each room.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Thank you. I was going to give it for us, but next time.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No problem.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, boy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? Do you have any gold left?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, I'm good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, Nott. You're a great gal. It's the occasional tongue-eating, is mostly what I was referring to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott, come on, let's go upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau, drunkenly, you have enough consciousness to recall eventually a knock at your door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. Right. I open the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Standing there, you see an amber-skinned elven woman, a little older than you, with very bright, almost platinum hair that is pulled up into a high ponytail that drifts past the shoulders, seeming a very sheer negligee.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uhh... Hi.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Looking up the spell?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, something else. You're good. Go on, get it on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Vorsah." She pushes you in the room and closes the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cut to black.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Nila was going to cover her ears.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're probably nailing a 250-year-old!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hot!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, elven aging! Cougar!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, exactly!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They call: this horrible, terrible-- It's a harsh north this side of Wildemount for these poor birds.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Welcome to Deadwood!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is very much the Deadwood of the continent. You can already hear the town coming alive outside; the occasional shouts-- you're unable to make out the words, but the morning has definitely kicked in. You gather your things and make your way down to the bottom floor where Champ is not currently there. There's somebody else-- looks to be a younger man, probably in his late teens, early 20s. He appears to be half-elven, with this curly mop of bright-red hair on the top and a smile, and he's currently going through a ledger of some kind.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I recognize him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: His name is Rex.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Rick and Rex.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Before going down with Nott and Caleb, I would say when we get up: We need to talk for a minute, okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen, you should just forgive Keg, she doesn't know that she was being insulting. She's rough around the edges-- and she's right, you could do better than me. Look at this. This is a mess. I mean, the teeth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't care about Keg or any of that. I want to talk about what you and I are doing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was this close to running off from that road when things turned on us. You and I, we are going to survive together. That is the main thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why didn't you run?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The dwarf stepped up. (snaps) Changed my mind like that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Changed your mind because we had extra help, or--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatever she said to him, he left.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, the danger was passed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But we have done a lot and you know what I am about.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course I do, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I just want you and I, you and me especially, to be on the same page because we have been for months now, ja? You are my friend, I want you to be with me, and I want us to live. We have done a lot with these people, and if we can finesse this and do it in a way that does not throw our lives in the fire, there is more to be achieved. We will help you get to where you want to get, and myself, together. We will work together with these people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He had this spirit of life that was pretty outstanding. You know, he was the moment that we all traveled together. He came up, and we were all talking, and all cagey, and all iffy with each other when we met all these folks but he said, "Hey, want to come see a circus show?" and that lit the spark, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But before that, it was-- All I'm saying is, he was a rainbow man who represented life at its fullest, and that's what I want. Even more than what we were going for before. Together, we're sort of living life now, aren't we? Before, we were in the darkness. So I know we have things to do, and I want to do them. But the reason I want to find these people and rescue them is not to use them, and it's not because we've invested time in them, but it's because I love them. We need to find them and rescue them because we're a team now. So if you're just using them or whatever, that's fine and I'll support you; but I want to find them so that we don't go back to the way it was, when we were hiding in the shadows and ducking into alleys to get away from people. We were safe, but we weren't really alive, right? With these people, we're having fun and winning contests and killing bad guys and rescuing children, and it's amazing. I hope you're with me on that, and I hope we are on the same page.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a good start. I think they like you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are not hiding anymore. Well, not like we used to. There is a certain amount of risk to what we are doing. And what I want is good, for more people than just me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know it is, and I want it for you. We've used a lot of people in the past and I just want to make sure we're not using these folks. Are we?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we are about to risk our lives to pull three people we met four or five weeks ago out of the hands of a lot of dangerous people. Seems like a pretty good offer for them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't have any family; you're the closest thing that I have. I have come to rely on you and I am grateful for your company.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I couldn't do this without you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, let's screw our courage to the sticking place and get them out of there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Let's get them home, and let's kill Lorenzo. I have an idea. I know my last one didn't go so well, but listen: we can't fight these people. I've said it before and I'll say it again, but what we can do is exactly what they do. They go out and pick off people one at a time. Why don't we start doing that to them? Follow them, track them, see where they go home at night, and just pick them off one at a time. The weaker ones first, and by the time Lorenzo knows what's happening, he'll be scared out of his mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He would get more defensive with time. I don't know. We don't know enough. I would like to find out where he sleeps.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Head-on, I agree, not a good idea. We will take a roundabout way. Let's figure out what we're talking about first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. To breakfast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I invite her in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll nestle in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's go down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As both Nila and Keg have enjoyed a decent meal, not as much as you'd expect for the money that was paid included for the evening's stay, but a meal nevertheless.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hotel prices. What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually Caleb and Nott make their way down to join you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: When Keg sees Nott, she pulls out a piece of paper and some broken spectacles and says, Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's this? What are you doing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm sorry I said that you were not good enough for--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why are you wearing those things?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm trying to apol-- just give me a second! I'm sorry I said you were not good enough for Caleb--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did someone tell you to do this?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're very nice-- I'm trying to be nice, just give-- this is as painful for me as it is for you, just give me five seconds!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, sure.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm sorry I was mean.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we get some hash browns or something?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You may be kind of weird, but you're also nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think there was a verb in that sentence.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I am sorry, and when you aren't eating tongue, you're sort of cute. Love, Keg.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, so, a few things.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you have notes?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, you don't need to sign it if you're saying.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know, I was writing it! I didn't know if I was going to say it to you or give it to you, so I panicked and I-- I'm sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau comes down the stairs, hearing the end of it, and just goes (applause)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thanks, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could learn a few things from you. That was a good apology. Damn good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Apology accepted. Don't worry about it, I have a thick skin about this stuff, and I know I haven't put my best foot forward with you. We got off on a wrong foot. To a brighter tomorrow!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was much more eloquent than mine was.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just made that up, I didn't even have to write it down.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You didn't even have to write it down?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck, I'm so bad at this. And then she shoves bacon in her mouth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so what's your plan?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (long sigh) We are going to go and meet the Marduns.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are going to ask for Ophelia Mardun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a feeling maybe her business has something to do with the Iron Shepherds as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We can hope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you know anything about any of the families here?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: They need help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Nila's out there healing the roosters and you're leaving, the young, curly red-haired half-elven proprietor at the front leans forward and says, "I'm sorry, I don't mean to intrude, but "whatever it is you're after, good luck and I hope you're on the right track."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Who the hell are you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's super weird. He seems like a nice, normal person here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it a female?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry, I'm Keelyn. I take the early shift here--" It's a man. Vibrant green eyes. "But I've "overheard you're going to see the Marduns. Just listen carefully."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen carefully?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Listen carefully.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like while we walk there, we should listen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you listen and talk with them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. Not right now, but when we are-- ja.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I imagine we should also be listening carefully right now, as well as then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That works as well, but--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's wrong with them? What should we know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nothing. They're gracious employers, I enjoy my time here, but just listen carefully. I'm "trying to help, that's all. Good day! Be off, be off!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I know, but why? We haven't paid you-- okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's very enigmatic, but we will-- okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good luck." Takes a little glass of tea and sips it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I do an insight check on him to see if he's sketchy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, go for it. He's pretty sketchy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I mean, yeah, but sketchy in the-- well, eight. Like is he trying to fuck with us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where are your 20s, Ashly, where are your 20s?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know, I wasted them all!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to read. He seems forthright enough, but also guarded. It's hard to tell.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How long have you been working for the Marduns?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Me? About six, seven months."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you like the work?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, it has its benefits."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You mean, like--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nott!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Be on your way and good luck." Sips the tea again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's totally what he means.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are those marks all over your neck?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Badge of honor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you get in a fight last night?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nott, for real, man. Context clues.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, you could say it was a nice little tussle. It was a nice little square off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who won?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'd say we both won.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Simultaneously?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Nila will offer you another goodberry, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh! Do they make my hickies go away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They definitely seem to recede a bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit. This is miracle cream, Nila! Oh my god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A use for goodberries I've not yet seen in my years playing D&D!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You could make a cosmetic line!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you make your way back into the streets of the city, you begin to make your way back into the Clover Plaza. Now, do you know where you're going?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I know a lot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've not been to these estates, specifically because your employers are diametrically opposed to the Marduns, but you know the vague idea of where it is. But you've never traveled there. You could probably ask around, if you'd like. If you were to search for somebody who would hopefully be of help.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Could we have asked that guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can go back and ask.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Should we go back and ask the creepy guy?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, he seems to know them. I guess so.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: One more thing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to go back and ask the creepy guy how to get to the Marduns'.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Keelyn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hi again!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hi. We should have asked this before we left the first time. Do you know where their estate is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're looking for them and you don't know where they are?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Northwest outskirts of the town limits, within the forest. Look for the dark red wood exterior."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You'll find it, I trust."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why are you helping us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Because this place is a shithole and decent people are hard to find."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll let you know if we find them. Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Weapons-- [crowd sound effects]

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How does he do that?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The timing!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where does he get such wonderful toys?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: BattleBards! And Syrinscape! You glance and see 20 or so of these figures, all in various types of armor and weapons. They're in lines, ramshackle. It resembles something military, but by people who aren't trained by military or at least have any interest in that type of regimented standing. You see, at glance, a few Empire soldiers, three in full armor. Not crownsguard, but from the actual military, that are inspecting up and down the line.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it like a militia that they're forming?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks to be. You recognize most of the folks here to be Grudge Gang.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a question?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is a difference between Crownsguard and Empire soldiers? Is one higher than the other?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well there's the military. The Crownsguard are essentially the general guardians of every township and they do day to day law enforcement.

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: Cops.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The actual military soldiers, you saw gathering on the outskirts of Zadash when the war first kicked in, and passed one of the large armies traveling eastward from up by the western side of the Silberquel Ridge.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I don't think we've ever discussed this, but is Caleb's father Crownsguard, or Empire?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Your father would have been low-level military.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which is below both of those?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. It's slightly above Crownsguard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're the Grudge Gang that we see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, and watching as you pass by. You get the sense that it looks like the Empire is hiring mercenaries for the war.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know-- Make a history check, actually. Caleb, you can make a history check too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not bad. That works. You've been at this for a while. The Savalierwood has been cursed for many centuries. The once-green forest now stands a greyish purple ashen color that it now holds and the superstition and mythology around it has allowed the city of Shadycreek Run to prevent Empire encroachment. They built the city into the space, and every time the Empire has attempted to move forward they've pulled back and used it as a defensive position. Essentially, over a number of conflicts, the Empire just gave up, and let the region exist on its own. It is dangerous, the wood. The deeper in, the more dangerous it gets.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And The Sour Nest is nestled into it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continuing on you begin to enter the canopy of the south Savalierwood. The shade completely consumes the city at this point, even though it's mid-morning and the clouds are broken up so that occasional bits of warmth and sunlight would occasionally pass through the city, now it seems like it's almost dusk immediately. Occasionally you see a leaf tumble past, and then another. It's almost beautiful, the color, but it does have almost a decaying sense to its meeting between grey and purple. It's beautiful in light, and then when it hits the ground it almost looks like it's bereft of life. You don't understand the nature of this enchantment, whatever this curse may be that you've heard of.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nila. Is there something wrong with the soil here or something? Do you know anything about this?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Do I have something that can tell? Do you know? (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you're not familiar with this where you are from?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You could do a general nature check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could do a nature check if you wanted to try--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I wanted to use Druidcraft, but I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll one of your buddies.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Plus eight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, no. Eight total.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It's right? This roll plus two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, yeah. This is beyond you. In all of your experience-- and you're very connected with the land of the valley-- this far north you've not encountered something like this. The forest-- the best you can tell, the forest still lives. The nature of where it draws its life and this color is very unnatural and it spooks you.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Is it like a half-dead forest? Like a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It feels alive and you pick up the leaf that you saw tumbled before you and you feel it and it still brims with health. It also off-puts you. You get chills and you don't know why.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I don't need to check my smell bag for this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think stink pouch is still my favorite phrase.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Stink pouch, fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, smell bag is great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Odor sack?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's somehow worse than stink pouch as far as what it evokes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sniff nuts.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Are there any animals?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was the name of the forest?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Ooh, it hit that, does that count? Can I roll again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It still counts, yeah, unfortunately.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see anything specifically. You do hear birds, so it isn't bereft of wildlife. At least you get the sense that there is at least a symbiotic relationship with some wildlife in the bit of the forest you've been in.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I'd love to take one of my goodberries to draw one of the birds and see if I might talk with it and see if it could tell us anything about before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an animal handling check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, what is this? Druid stuff.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: 12 plus seven. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you hold the goodberry out, which, with your arm length, is a good nine, nine and a half feet up towards the lower hanging branches, and you (bird song) give a little counterwhistle to the sound of one of the birds you hear. You hear a retort (bird whistle) and you return it (bird whistle), and then it returns (bird whistle, flutter), and then down onto the edge of your hand you see this tiny little blackbird with a white stripe that goes down the edge of each wing. It-- (chirping)-- and starts eating the goodberry, messing the edge of its beak.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- giant shitty rooster.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (squawk)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's eating the goodberry. What would you like to do?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: What would we like to ask it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: First thing that pops into my mind is do you know Kiri, but I don't think that's relevant.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have to stop thinking that all people who look like each other know everybody.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't they though?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Maybe, "How long has this curse been here? How long has the forest been "spooky-ooky?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they know how much further the Marduns' keep is?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there any monsters out there?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: That's too much, one at a time! How long has the forest been like this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you using a spell or are you using your firbolg ability?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh, I'm using my firbolg ability.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That allows you to speak to animals.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Wait, which one is it?

lines.name: LIAM, SAM
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Do you know which one it is?

lines.name: MARISHA, LIAM
lines.text: Speak with Animals.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Speech of the woods!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nila's just staring at this bird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Speech of the woods is your firbolg ability.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh. I know I have it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you look on your spell list, the cards you have prepared, do you have Speak with Animals prepared?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I know I have it. Oh, it's because I chose my Spirit Totem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh right. Because you're Shepherd.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes. I have--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes you do, because you're Circle of the Shepherd.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Whew!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You got this!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I was like, "I set this all up and then I'm not going to be able to talk to the bird!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's an Iron Shepherd, kill her!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get to mark off one of your 1st-level spells. As you ask the bird, the bird returns-- and you guys hear her whistle to the bird, and the bird whistles back quite a bit, this beautiful song that plays. The bird conveys to you, "Far, far before my time."

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It says it's been this way a long time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow. I mean, how long is long for a bird though?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They only live for three weeks, right? That's probably a bad question.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: This bird lives a long time, I can tell you. This type of bird is not a short-lived bird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dagon can live to be 30. She's going to outlive us all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you like to ask it what is dangerous in the wood?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes. What is most dangerous here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Be wary of spirits."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, spirits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Be wary of bone-spurred beasts."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bone-spurred beasts. Okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Doesn't sound great.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: What other questions? Are you still willing to answer some more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How long does the spell last?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three days.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The bird's a party member now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It lasts for ten minutes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far are we from the Mardun house? I don't know if the bird is going to know--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I don't think the the bird would know the Mardun house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we can describe it: red wood house.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mansion!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Red wood mansion.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh, all right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Northwestish.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I'd like to send the bird, mentally, the picture of what that bird's eye view would be and to see if the bird has seen that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you focus and express mentally and through small verbal gestures towards it the idea of this color and this shape. Immediately the bird (flapping) takes off.

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: (gasp) Follow the bird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One has a crossbow at their side, the other has a shortbow across their shoulder. One is sitting, looking out. The other looks like they're eating some sort of dried meat from a pouch, and they glance over and watch as you approach and keep an eye.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they look like Taskers? Do they have the same armor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not Taskers, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're probably just guarding the place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hired hands.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does someone want to go talk to them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja. That is not a problem. Hello.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that's sitting, stands up and puts his crossbow like-- ready, not pointing it at you, but--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja. We are good here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What is your intent here?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have been traveling a great distance. We are here to speak, if you don't mind, we have a message for Ophelia Mardun. It can only be heard by her. We have been charged with this message and no funny business. I hope that we could impart our message and be done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can take your message and pass it on!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you tell her that a very refined gentleman from the south would like to pass his regards to her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja. (groans)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (southern accent) A southern gentleman.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not very good at all.

lines.name: SAM, ASHLEY
lines.text: (groan)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "And there's five of you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is a long way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And an important message.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Only a fool travels alone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense immediately that there's a general anxiety and tension at this space when strangers approach. They're being very careful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I look around, do I see anybody who's hidden, watching from windows up above, anything that looks like we're being watched?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not by guards, necessarily. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance up, and on the second floor there is two sets of double windows. They're paned, one of them looks to be partially opened, and you can see on the inside there are curtains. One, the curtains are closed, the other is drawn to a side, and you see a figure looking out below. As soon as you look up and see it, the curtain closes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did I catch a glimpse of what the figure looks like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The figure looked to be human, though the skin was dark. That's as best as you can get before they vanished.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm just smiling at the guards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see all the other guards each place one of their weapons pointed directly at each of you, and the quiet comes over all of you, as this moment, this standoff continues for a minute, two minutes. As the first guard that you spoke to enters and closes the door behind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (exhales)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So do you like being guards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Shh!" One of them tightens the grip.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This large, heavy crossbow already notched backward and the tension on the wire itself is-- this guy is looking like he is ready to fire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are all going to laugh about this later, I promise. (nervous laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A moment later the guard emerges from the door. "All right, stand down."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all pull their weapons away, looking disappointed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are good?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see bony crests of horns that curve up into these two large points behind the head and bright yellow eyes that are pupil-less. A grin that shows two fanged canines. As she descends you can see her attire is very formal, colonial style coat with epaulets, but it seems to be tailored to not hide her figure. She already exudes an air of powerful aggression and presence. With each step that she takes down there, you can sense her immediately reading and seeing in and through each of you. Quietly she takes the last step to the landing here in the foyer. (German accent) "You bring tidings from The Gentleman, you say."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is correct, ja.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well you have invoked the name of my comrade. You have my attention, do not squander "it. Why are you here?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we will be plain. He has sent us. He has told us that you are in need of assistance, and he has deemed us worthy to provide it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you Ophelia?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, just making sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It could be someone else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thorough, I appreciate that. Well so, you are the help that he sent. Timely, three days "earlier would have been better, but here we are. I shall not fret on it. Thank you for coming. Be at "ease, go watch the back walls, make sure nobody tries to sneak in while we're talking." The guards all scatter, except for two who stay posted at each side of the door behind you. "How much have "you been told?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (small laugh) Not very much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "(sighs) I've had an open line of shipments to Zadash, through our mutual friend for some time, "made a beneficial arrangement for many years."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do an insight check? Did it look like she cast a spell just then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, make an insight check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, whispers.

lines.name: SAM, ASHLEY
lines.text: Whispers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys--

lines.name: LIAM, SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Am I right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is a really good app.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (flatly) It's so great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like-- I can be on the shitter, if I want to check--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can customize that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb's spells.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can with their new upgrade.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can be mid dook.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can be mid dook?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mid dook and check my spells.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're mid dook right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway, bringing it back in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shipments to Zadash.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "However, my most trusted team of smugglers that handle that route and knew it well were slain "a little over a month ago."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know by whom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, at first we thought it was maybe the dire beasts of the wood around us, but our "internal priest was able to divine the source of their demise. In other words, at the hands of the Jagentoths."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The who? What?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's the family that controls the Iron Shepherds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Jagendoths?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The Jagentoths.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now we've-- as you seem to know this well." She looks over you. "You look familiar. What is "your name?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Keg.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Keg, I know that name."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I used to work for them. Not anymore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point you hear the guards behind (cocking crossbow). The crossbows go back up into position. You glance over your shoulder to see them both pointed-- "What assurances can I have "that I not need strike you down where you stand?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You don't have any, but I have a lot of information about them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We just killed one of them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, that's true. That's better. We killed one of them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check with advantage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That is a 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We here of the Estate Sybaritic require you to cut "one of the limbs of their business. Kill their best handymen. Hunt the Iron Shepherds."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One more time, please?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hunt the Iron Shepherds."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your accent is thick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have not been as far south as some of you, I can tell."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I appreciate hearing the old tongue again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She says to you in Zemnian, "Well, stick around." (in Common) "Last I heard, they are still "out on the road. They live at The Sour Nest, a small stronghold not far from here on the edge of "North Clover to the eastern side. They have a number of hired hands that guard the locale. It's "a difficult infiltration, but it's your best chance of catching them off guard. If you have "other ideas, we are open to suggestions. Am I to believe that you have been sent," and her eyes fall over Nila, "as trained killers, able to deal with this?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everyone has been carefully selected, carefully vetted. I'm sure that with your input on their mannerisms and habits, their routines, we will do quite well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Let us hope that the priest was not incorrect. Either way, I would like to see "them taken down a peg. So do you accept this offer?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What all do you want us getting out of that house?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nothing to get out of it. Kill everything within it."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: When you say this can't get traced back to you guys, does that mean you can't help us at all? Give us any assistance as far as your men, firepower, nothing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. We can offer maybe a bit of change to grease a few palms or bring some aid your way, but "we cannot be traced to this at all. This needs to seem unrelated. A strange occurrence, a random act "of murder was in their home, so as not to quell this already boiling blood between us."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You think all of the Iron Shepherds will be there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But if you've made it this far north, perhaps you "are better at finding this information than we."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Any tips to specifically deal with your problem?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Best intel we have involves that they hire their mercenaries from the Grudge Gang. They "prefer to find people with keen eyes and distant shot."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Grudge Gang-- they've hired the entire gang, or just the members of the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Just members of the gang."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where do they hang about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All over the city, but the ones they've hired will probably stay within the estate."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They would stay there while they're under the employ of the Iron Shepherds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. That is what I do." She refers to the two guards behind you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you know-- sorry. You can go.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You said that they're still on the road? You're led to believe that they haven't come back to Shadycreek Run yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't seen them return yet, no."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would you know if they came back? Do you have spies out there looking?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because we saw them on the road and they were heading back here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If they have arrived recently, perhaps my whispers have not come to me yet."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's a chance The Sour Nest is empty, or less guarded.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wonder if they're hiring.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does the Grudge Gang identify themselves in some way? How would we find one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They usually--" and she pulls back her sleeve and you can see the dark gray, almost black skin there beneath. "You will find a burned crescent into the wrist of a member of the gang."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's get a fireplace and some iron and burn the shit out of our wrists, and then we're insta-Grudge Gang. Now, The Gentleman has us on a meager yearly salary, but if we were to do this for you, does that include some sort of bonus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you saying The Gentleman has not paid you for this endeavor?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I was made to understand that that was all taken care of as part of our arrangement."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How about something in trade? Just as a little added bonus as a favor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What are you asking for, if I might inquire, little girl?" She leans forward with this creepy smile that crawls across her face as she eyes you up and down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There we go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kind of like her demeaning me with that little girl stuff. I'm kind of into it. Anyway, that priest you mentioned. Is he a pretty skilled priest? Would he happen to have any skills in reviving the dead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You have a problem with someone beneath the earth. I do not know if our priest specializes in "such abilities, and if they did, it would be for family only."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sounds like he does specialize in those abilities when you put it like that. If exceptions can be made for friends and family. Friends and family discount is a real thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're mighty presumptuous. You might have better luck with any of the wandering crazies in "the city."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Our priest is not the only one." She cocks her head. "If you're looking for help, could look "to the Blooming Grove."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where's that? What's that? Is that a town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Otherwise, you need to do quite a favor for us, as such magic is not inexpensive."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Killing all of the Iron Shepherds isn't a big enough favor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You've already been paid for that."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, this is a pre-existing arrangement that's outside of negotiation at the moment. I understand. We will take care of what you are asking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. That's what I like, straightforward and working to the fine print. Very good."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Zemnian.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. You don't want us staying here, I suppose? We should scoot out so that we can't be traced back to you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We'll lead you out the back route. Eyes on you leaving my estate would be unwise. So." Begins speaking in Zemnian to the two other guards-- you're the only one who picks up on the language-- says, "Please lead them through the back tunnel." She turns around and begins to ascend the stairs, stopping and looking back over her shoulder, the hair swishing with each step as she makes her way up, looking back, and the yellow eyes glancing back with the bright white teeth against the darkened skin. "Do not disappoint me. I can be very frustrated when I'm disappointed." Turns back and makes her way back up the steps.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're left with guards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two guards, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, good fellows, would you escort us out and point us in the right direction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They wordlessly walk and lead you around through a dining chamber back to a small storage-- it'd be kitchen adjacent, though you don't see a kitchen yet. You can smell that musty scent of stored oats and grains, rice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did I see any books on the way out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: None down here. None of the rooms you were brought through seem to have any sort of a shelf unit or anything that carries tomes or books of any kind, unfortunately.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fuck this podunk town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There doesn't seem to be very well-read people though there're probably some. You're led into this storage room and down a staircase through a trapdoor. It's pulled open. You're led into this wine cellar and in the back of the wine cellar, they move aside a case shelving for wine, and they're all resting on it, some missing, others moving it there. There's a small tunnel that you all have to duck down. You have to nearly crawl through to get your rather large firbolg form.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I sleight of hand and try to steal some wine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was about to ask if I recognize any wine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're moving pretty fast. Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe I shouldn't.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's too late now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, it's great! 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you get?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, you can't see any of the labels the way it's rested. However, you do manage to grab a bottle of wine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, is that a Cabernet Sauvignon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are brought through single-file through this tunnel until eventually, met with another door. The guard (knocking) does some sort of pulsed knock. It opens and from this completely dark interior, the light hits your eyes and you have to adjust for a moment. It's really not that bright on the opposite side; it's still within the forest. Comparatively, it hits you. As you step out, there looks to be an older drunk, dirty, filthy-looking man who is completely sober and lets you out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The old man goes and sits back, puts his bench up against the knotted base of a thick tree that's growing out of the ground where you had emerged from. Leans against it, grabs a jug and sits and looks at you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I tell where The Sour Nest would be from here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a survival check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With how far you've traveled north, it would be straight due east from here.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Sour Nest is east of here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know where you are?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we go run recon? Take a quick scouting pass and see what we can see?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Let's put a little distance between ourselves and this place and this gentleman and I will send Frumpkin out to have a look.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way through the Savalierwood.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it a long walk? Or a long travel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From where you are now, it's probably a two hour walk. It's the far east side. It's technically past the-- let's see, I have all the locations here. Pardon me as I pull out my notes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While you look, I will say an important point for clarification. Once we are out of the view of this gentleman guarding the secret entrance, Caleb, walking with poise up to a tree, leans against it, bends down and has a panic attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were in great in there!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Past the Gruff Slum is what it is. This is the far eastern side of it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Past the Gruff Stump?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Gruff Slum.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Man, you were rock-solid in there!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stop it. I am nauseous. Let's go kill a bunch of people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give him a goodberry.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I have a goodberry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is sour.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a Purin tablet.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: One moment, it will take effect soon.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh. End that way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keep it down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does warm your belly, and that warmth spreads through your torso and it's-- whenever Jester has come and pulled you from the edge of death with a spell, it's a fragment of that warmth from the inside of your torso.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 'Member?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 'Member berries. 'Member Jester?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 'Member clerics?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah, I 'member.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Following Keg through the wood, I would like you all to make stealth checks, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stealthy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are no longer under the Pass without a Trace spell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You get all of your spells back after sleeping as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Four!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb's feeling a bit clumsy, but the rest of you, keeping up the slack, have managed to stop him at times and make him aware of his terrible attempts to stay out of sight and stay quiet. Two hours of travel eastward--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We should plan.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We wanted to send Frumpkin in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can send Frumpkin, but also, we have another animal companion now. If you wanted to become an animal something or other and scout around, that would be acceptable, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I would love that. What animal do you think would be the best? Maybe something small?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And something native.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, Frumpkin's a bird, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we need something on the ground, like a weasel-y thing or a ratty type of thing or a roachy type of thing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You said yesterday that-- you were a horse first and then you said you could only do it one more time or a certain number of times, correct?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes, I have two times now, right? Because I rested?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Two times every short rest.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can do twice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you were to become, say, a raccoon right now and go running around, that is one time that you cannot become a crocodile to eat somebody's face off.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes, and I would like to eat somebody's face off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He will go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In owl form?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should still do that, though, first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, I could turn him back into a cat, but then he's slower, he can't get over the walls maybe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just send the bird.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far have we traveled at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About an hour into it, a sound catches your ear, Keg. It catches yours as well. (growling) You hear the faint breaking of tinder and dry branch.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I know what this is off the top or must I make a check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a straight intelligence check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) Ooh, that's not going to go well for anyone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Unless you roll high.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: SUMALEE, MARISHA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but it's minus one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So it's zero! Did I help?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea, but it sounds unique.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ducks, you guys. It's ducks.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're fine, keep going.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, great!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But Nila also recognizes it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear it as well. What's your perception? Your passive perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. You'd actually hear it as well. You guys all put your hands out, stop, and hold still. You see a heavy shadow moving through the dense forest, just south of where you are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nobody move. You want to send an owl towards that shadow, see if Frumpkin sees what that is?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, okay, that's easy. I sit down on the ground and send Frumpkin into the air.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Its fur is long and matted, almost greasy in patches. At the shoulders and the elbows and ridges on its face, you see bone protrusions, like spikes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Those were the bone spikes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it comes through you watch its large, heavy, almost exaggerated muscular shoulders (sounds of bear walking, growling, and sniffing) It sits down on the ground. It seems to have chosen a spot to take a nap.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I have a sense of what aggros it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Noise. People. Anything that it could eat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispering) There is a very large black bear ahead of us, with bones coming out of its butt and stuff and it has just laid down for a nap.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispering) We have to be very quiet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) Can you do that thing again?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That makes us all stealthy?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: (whispering) Yes, of course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) So we can all sneak by?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. With that addition, everyone roll another stealth check, since you are taking the bonus there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are we going to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Gil. Eh, fuck you, Gil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that with the plus ten?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Without, so I'm at 33.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you do have heavy armor, so you do have disadvantage on your stealth checks, I remember that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: With ten, it's 23 again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go, it's still pretty good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's the numbers!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I rolled a d20 plus ten, right? Oh, plus my-- that's why, I was like, it seems low. 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Alongside it, (growls), awakens slightly and sits down next to it and while it's not sleeping, is keeping watch as it releases out of its jaw, onto the ground a very bloodied and battered body of some person, you cannot make any details of them at this distance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Definitely not living! As you begin to walk, you begin to hear the terrible crunching sound as its giant jaws snap into bone and tear into flesh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continuing onward. The secondary hour goes without issue, but you do begin to come upon the outskirts of your recollection of where The Sour Nest resides. You're still a good 100 or so feet away, using the trees at your disposal and you can see now the wall that matches the perimeter. It's a thin, five foot wide wall with a very flimsy rail across the top, but it is a walkway for watch guards to keep an eye out. As you glance at this distance, you can see one figure that's walking the perimeter of the top of the wall, with a heavy crossbow at the ready. They stop and look out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How dense is the forest around this place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty dense. The reason it took two hours to get there is because you're going through the forest. Otherwise on foot, in any sort of open scenario, it would take you half the time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's just nestled among trees around it or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a massive stronghold, it looks to be approximately a little larger than the Estate Sybaritic that you were at, but it's more for function than beautiful decor. A lot of the wood seems to be old and weathered from rain and dry seasons. It's just a beige- and gray-looking establishment. Pure function.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Our lot is hidden in the trees, a ways away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. You can barely see it above the wall, but the little bit you can see has that visual and you can see it's a mixture of stone and wood. The edges of the actual structure are stone and then wood is either then placed over stone or wood is the intermediate construction material.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The cart is not back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this perspective, you don't see where the cart would come in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is where we send an owl.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to send him and it's going to take a moment. I want him to go around the entire place and keep an eye on it and watch it. Maybe 20 or 30 minutes. Are we good with that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In his talons, he could bring a little mouse and drop it in there. I'm just saying.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How will we-- You and I could talk to the mouse.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could, but the mouse couldn't talk back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, wait, wait, what's our plan here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, for now this is easy, we're going to send my owl now. If anything goes wrong, will you please tap three times on my left knee? I go blind and send Frumpkin up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so, Frumpkin makes it up. Tree, waits a moment, tree. The one guard you see doing the perimeter notices.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I tell him telepathically to just chill and sit there for a while.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With advantage, due to the form, because it is with sight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perception, you say? 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. Looking through these curved window ports about that big, essentially large enough to look through and fire through, but small enough to not really allow a person to push through. You can see there's about two inches of stone, so it is a stone structure that has wood as a decorated exterior to it, so it's pretty solid. Down inside, you do see about six horses that are hitched on the back side of it and two carts and a third one that is currently being repaired.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those are our carts!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many people do I see down inside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like there are two doing a perimeter pass, matching each other so that at any given point in time they have a visual perspective on one or the other's side of the estate. You see one more guard that is inside the courtyard and it looks like two individuals that are not in general attire of the hired hands. The guards are wearing the same hooded cloak and armament as the two that were pulling the caravan up with them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Those are definitely the caravans? The carts that Frumpkin sees are the ones that we--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are very much. The one that's been broken has been carried along the way and temporarily fixed for the journey, but now has two individuals of plain clothes that are in the process of repairing the cart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Total two up top?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two up top, one on the inside that's armed, and two that are currently repairing the cart that appear to be unarmed. You gather from the state of repairs that the arrival was probably not that long before you arrived.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So much for getting the jump on them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Three guards, two hired hands, and were there two more regular individuals?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, there were two guards on the wall, only one you see inside the courtyard, and then two handymen. You don't really know if they work for them full-time or if they're a temporary hire, but there are two men that are not in the general attire of the rest of the guards of the estate that are currently repairing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They definitely don't know any ice magic.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Definitely sorcerers, definitely no ice magic. Definitely. Is it accurate to say that if we were to find Grudge Gang members that were unaffiliated, that we could pay them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you have enough.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, because from where I'm sitting, I don't know how this is going to go much different than what happened before. We might need more people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Grudge Gang, they can be expensive and also they're not keen on suicide missions if they have no stake in it. But if they have a stake in it, and you pay well enough, and you have assurances and enough to back you up, they'll go with it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Would the Taskers have more of a stake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You grew up hating a lot of the bits of authority that existed around here and now you're finding yourself having to eat crow for a lifetime of--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's like my thing. Yeah, it's my new thing: eating crow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you say how big the structure within the wall is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to really gauge the full distance. It's a fairly large estate that's been fitted into a small stronghold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Could make a distraction in the woods, get one of the guard's attention. Bring them in one at a time. Ambush them. Take their wardrobe.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Or we could watch them for awhile.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have a sword that can teleport you. You could bamf up onto the walkway with them and knock one off, and we could kill him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Between me and Nila, we could actually get in pretty quickly. I could get in with the sword and she could be dropped in as a mouse.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The Iron Shepherds aren't there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
