lines.text: Frumpkin doesn't see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin doesn't see them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can certainly kill a guard. That would give us a costume, but what does that get us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They find a dead man on their perimeter and know that someone is fucking with them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can drag his body off and feed it to a bear. Steal his clothes. They'll be like "Where "did he go? Where did Phil go? Oh, Phil. You know, that old story." Or we drop in mouse girl and she could run around inside and find out if her son is in there, and our friends.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I'm so confused. The carts that we see were the ones that I've seen people go into before, but we don't see the Iron Shepherds here.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We don't see where the prisoners are being kept?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see that, but you know. The basement below. There are three separate chambers: one that's for holding, one that's for breaking, which is torture, and the one that is for display if they have any final approvals by the Jagontoth family that has an idea of where they should be sent to.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: This is our best chance, because there are no Iron Shepherds here.

lines.name: ASHLEY, SAM
lines.text: We don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They could be inside. This is not any better than our chances on the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, then we do one of two things. We either send in Nila as a mouse to scout to see if The Iron Shepherds are in there, or we wait and we watch and we see who comes in and out. Watch the guard shifts, see when the changeover is.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I want to go in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A guard shift would be the most opportune time to attack. When they're changing shifts.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do we have any interest in trying to get more people?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Yes. I don't know how much money we have.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I have a sense of how expensive the Grudge Gang is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've never hired any of them, so you're not sure, but the way to ask would be to go find them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Looking through Frumpkin's eyes, was I able to see the entrance through this wall that the guards are up top on? What's the way in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the opposite end, it looks to be ladders.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No gate or doorway at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, sorry. I thought you meant how they got up onto the wall, my apologies. There is a gate in the front and there is a gate in the back. The gate in the back is-- actually, both gates are two dark wood doors that have a brace set down that holds them in place that is held and controlled from the interior.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Solid?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Solid.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: None of this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On both sides it looks like a single brace that comes down from one side.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The back gate, is that pressed against the forest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both gates have about a ten-foot open space before it reaches forest. There are stumps and there are places where trees were cleared out, specifically to give that opening so that they'd have a good idea and good visual on anybody who'd attempt to approach.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keg, do you know if these people would have a secret entrance into the basement, to the dungeon area? Tunnels?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I have some sense of that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You didn't work close enough with them to know of any secret passage. I mean, it makes sense. There might be one, but nothing that you've come across. If there is one, it's a well-guarded secret. You have no idea.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Has anything changed since last I was here, that I can tell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not really. They're not into renovations.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If it works, stick with it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do the guards sleep here on the estate, or do they go home at night?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'd assume they'd stay on the estate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They sleep on the estate. They're paid essentially as live-in employ guards.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know how we do this.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I just want to see my son. I want to go inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want to go in and scout around?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How long does your magic last?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Good question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For you, it's half your druid level, rounded down, so per transformation, it's about two hours.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How do you get out if you are in a mouse?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Through a gate.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The gates are solid.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought you said there was a--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's why I asked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a solid gate?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, if she were to run out into the clear area, you could use Frumpkin, as if Frumpkin was hunting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To pick her up. Helivac her out!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Possible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Owls eat mice. I'm just saying. It makes sense in nature.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you make yourself a very distinct looking mouse, like a shock of white hair on the mouse head or something like that? Something unique?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: So that your friend wouldn't mistake me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I think I can. A particular type of field mouse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do that.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I just want to get close.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nila, do you promise that if you see your son, you're not going to try anything on your own?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I know I won't succeed, so I won't. I just want to get a look.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Send in the animals.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll help you find your son. Keep it together in there, all right?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I will.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now, here's the thing: goblin girl and hobo wizard have this spell where they can talk into your ear. You probably won't be able to respond back as a mouse except for maybe squeaks. Squeaks?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about one squeak is "yes," two squeaks is "no."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three squeaks is, "My son's been compromised! Please come rescue me! I'm dying in here! Please "come get me!"

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Three squeaks--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Oh my god, everything's gone to shit!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would Comprehend Languages work with a mouse, or no? That would be a different spell, right? Speak with Animals?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Comprehend Languages has to be spoken languages or written language.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I agree, yeah.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I'm not going to do three squeaks because I'm going to hold it together and I will come out. Right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, K.I.T. Keep it together.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Absolutely. You are a strong, powerful firbolg. Are you sure you don't know Pumat Sol?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You were doing so well.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's one of you. There's four of him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "He's one of you?" That's so generalizing and demeaning.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, they're kind of all the same, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY, MARISHA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Now it's demeaning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Matt drowns the future comments.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You must know Jareth the Goblin King? You're buddies with him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All goblins are different.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Question, where this collection of barrels--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Green privilege. Go on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The collection of barrels. Are they on the inside in the courtyard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're inside the courtyard, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How about we use that barrel pile as your meeting point? We'll make sure that Frumpkin's watching the barrel pile, and you get back there when you're done scouting.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I'm up for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, you know, don't fuck it up.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: There is that word again. It has many meanings.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Truth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you take your form, then?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes, I will take my form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god, this is so exciting!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nila's large firbolg physicality blinks down to this tiny little field mouse. What characteristic of it do you want to stand out?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so happy.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: The nice white stripe across the top, from its head all the way down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like a skunk mouse. Like Stripe from Gremlins. All right, there is Nila in mouse form.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, but we didn't talk about the first part. Frumpkin's got to bring her in there. Buddy, don't eat, just carry her. Stay away from the two on the top, okay? Put her by the barrels if you can. Then come back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin moseys up to the edge of your shoulder. Looks over towards her. Lands on the ground next to you, does a couple of hops up to you.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I offer my neck to pick me up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For a brief moment you all inhale, and you see the claws have wrapped around the mouse's body. Suddenly, you're soaring through the air, a sensation you've never had before. As Frumpkin makes his way over into the trees, make a stealth check for Frumpkin, please.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As he's going, I tell him: Correction, find an out of the way place to sit and watch those barrels. Stealth, you say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For my owl, so I have to go to the other page. The owl page.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which I have ready.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have an owl page on D&D Beyond?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That wonderful service?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god, the house is full of tabaxi!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We sent in a laser pointer! Shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the best use of Prestidigitation. Look at the red light! As you're soaring through the boughs, the leaves and the branches soar past, the wind past your face. You get that high view of down into the courtyard as suddenly you go into a steep dive. Within a moment, you're lifted back up and then dropped onto the ground next to one of the barrels. Frumpkin takes off. The guard glances over, and is going to take a shot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Take your shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural five! It's going to put it at a nine. I'm pretty sure that doesn't hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does not hit my owl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (arrow hissing) "Eh, shit," you hear muttered over the side. Seems bored and wanted to shoot at something that looked interesting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You hear beside you: Arschloch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you are in the courtyard now.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I want to go toward--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My terrible map of what I think based on what he drew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not bad. Immediately glancing around, make a perception check, actually, as you are coming into the courtyard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Were the porthole windows in the wall, or in the actual building?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They were in the wall of the second floor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of the building?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of the building, yes.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Shit! Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to see any specific areas where you can get in other than the main doors. There is a slight gap between the front door to the entrance and the floor of the interior. Other than that, scooting around the exterior, it's the only entrance you see.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: P.O.V., two inches tall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, right at the bottom. This is some Honey I Shrunk the Kids shit now.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I should have talked to my friends before to get a plan. Nila's a little confused again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear the sound of work being done on the carts around the side, and all you see is that front door with that slight gap at the bottom. What are you doing?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I think I want to go underneath the gap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You scoot, squeeze under, flattening out your mouse body and making your way through on the inside. The immediate warmth hits you from the cold exterior of the forest. The inside is, mostly being stone, comparatively, the temperature is much warmer in here. Coming inside, it's still a flat stone floor. It's not very well decorated at all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So judgy.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Field mouse is not looking at the decoration.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking inside, there is one curved stone staircase that leads up to the second floor. There is a hall that goes to the left and further down to one side. There is a closed door that leads into an interior chamber, and that's all you can see at the moment. The spiral staircase up, the door ahead of you, and the hall that curves around the side.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know it's down.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: What are the other two options?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Around to the side or a closed door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This floor, upstairs or downstairs.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Downstairs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do the spiral stairs go up and down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They only go up, yes.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I have to pick one of the two doors and hope that it leads down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door or the hallway, one of the two.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I'll choose... the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's the game show host problem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do know that at least they've returned and there are some present inside. It does not appear that there's any other entrance downward. There's a secondary door on the opposite end.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Go to the secondary door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, mouse. Come on, mousey-poo. Oh! That's good!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Squeakers!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are weapons that are hung up on racks. There are a couple of small wooden poles with dowels in the sides that are meant to hold armor, shields and things that are there, additional crossbows and things that the guards probably utilize at different points. This is an equipment storage room. There is another door to the left. Where you entered and squeezed underneath, there is a door to the left that you can go under as well. As you leave and pass that room, you head to a back hallway to this interior part of this level. This hallway continues down and seems to meet the hall that continued around the left side, and then continues on. To the right, there is another door that leads into another chamber.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Got to do it. Down the hall to the right chamber. This now I know that I didn't have to go down that other hallway, the first one, because that's already met up here, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other hallway would have continued this way, and the hallway you're just emerging now, meets with it. Then on that right side of it, there is a door that leads into whatever room is the next one over from that mess hall chamber. You head into that room? Heading down that room, it's a small closet-like room, and there is a trapdoor on the ground.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: That's it, but how do I open the trapdoor now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe there's a little crack or something.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: That's what I think is my way downstairs, so I go toward the trapdoor, see if I can't get in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check in your mouse form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Try and squeeze under? This is when a natural 20 is-- aw.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Nine, that's a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your mouse isn't strong enough to budge the door that is currently--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There might be a hole in the floor or something else.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I feel like that's the key, but I want to keep looking to see how many Iron Shepherds there may be in any other location that I haven't explored.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're pushing against the door, you do hear voices muffled from below. Then you hear what sounds like a laugh, a deep billowing laugh.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Can I gnaw my way through the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can! And in a few days, you'll probably make your way through.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I hear a laugh. Oh, have I heard this laugh before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: That's what I believe. I don't know what to do now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can you guys talk to her?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can send a Message.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: After a while, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll send a Message saying: Are you still alive?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: (squeaks)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's still alive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sumalee, what are you going to do?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I am going to stick to my mission to scout. I am going to pull everything I have to go away from the trap door, knowing where it is, and I am going to scurry up and I want to explore that spiral staircase.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you following down the hall or are you heading back through the mess room?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I'll go the hallway this time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you scurry around the hallway. There is nobody in there, so there is no one you are trying to hide from. You make it back to the main entryway, head to the staircase, and it takes you awhile to get up there, because the steps are about that high each. It's a little jump, and then you miss a few and have to stop and skitter back up. It takes you awhile, the better part of about 20 to 25 minutes. You eventually make your way to the second floor. Up there, you can see another hallway and as opposed to the bottom floor, which had an L-shaped hallway that went around, this one has a perimeter hall. There are those porthole windows that are carved into the stone, two on each side. As you come up to the top, the hall goes around and there's a central chamber on the inside, or chambers if they're divided. You can see immediately on the second floor, a door directly available to the one that's just north of you. You don't see any other door on this particular corridor.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: All right, let's crawl under that door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You scoot beneath that door and inside there, you can see a number of beds. You see four different beds that are lined up. You also find a familiar smell: other mice. Specifically, the urine of other mice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ugh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance over and in the corner you can see one of the comforters that has been partially eaten and pulled down and tugged. There is a slight hole in the stone on the edge. You can distinctly smell that there are other mice that live in this space.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Is there anyone in the beds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry. Yeah, nobody on the beds.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No people to be seen anywhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, not in this room.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Okay. What else can I cover? I want to cover everything and gather as much of the layout.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say as you move into one of the other rooms, the next two, you do notice that there are two other chambers. This upper floor is divided into three different chambers. There is the wide one that has the four beds, there's one that has two other beds, and there's one that has a singular large bed. This one room is almost like a master bedroom. You gather this is probably the room that Lorenzo sleeps in. It's a wider bed. It has, of all the other middling elements of comfort, this one comparatively is more extravagant, more comfortable. The layers of cushions--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A Dwendalian king.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Goddamn it, Sam. Make a perception check.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Good. 19.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everywhere!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: That's what the mice are eating.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look up and there is a makeshift table on the side of the bed, and a stone platter that sits on there, and the remains of a meal. The smell in here is old and slightly decayed, like something had died. You glance up and you can see some a bit of graying flesh and a faint glisten of white.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh, god. I want to explore. I want to get closer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. There is an edge of the bed that you can eventually scurry up and use that to climb up onto the bed itself. The bed is bowed pretty heavy. The actual bed was wide; whatever weight it's carried from Lorenzo is sunken rather deep in there. It's a bit of a pit as you crawl across it, the blankets tossed and folded over. You make your way to the edge and look over to this platter and what you see appears to be bones. Bones that are covered in strips and elements of leftover meat.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Do I know what kind of meat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a skull. A tiny skull.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy. That's not good.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: An animal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not animal.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I'm almost about to squeak three times but I'm going to hold it together. I want to get out now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (thumping sounds) You hear the shifting of leather. Make a stealth check... with the mouse's dexterity which--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh right. Oh, that's probably better with the mouse than with Nila.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've got luck.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh yes, thank you! Luck! Thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead. Use that luck point.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Thank you, Sam! It's allowed!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, no, I know! I'm so thankful because, as you come down the staircase, you see, looming up, towards the muscled form of a tired, but intent to peruse his domain, Lorenzo, making his way up the same staircase. No glaive in his hands. As you step up, you manage to wait for the right moment, hiding in the shadow of the step. As his legs cross over, you dart down to make your way, and he doesn't see a thing. You make your way back down into the main entryway to this, back out under the main entrance under the door. You are now in the courtyard. You head on over to the barrels.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes! Squeak, squeak, squeak! Come get me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin has kept watch, specifically sees the mouse return. Darts down and snatches you up in your form and swoops up. Make a stealth check for Frumpkin. The same guard is getting slightly--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. He glances over and sees Frumpkin dart down and goes "I got ya."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, still--I mean good for you!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Good for Nila!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin goes up into the trees, back down to you guys. They are waiting patiently, watching as the owl returns and on the ground releases the mouse form of Nila.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (clapping) Awesome! What did you learn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She is still a mouse.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can she become not a mouse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If she wants to.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes, I would like to shift out of my mouse form.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tell us everything!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was awesome!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What was?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She didn't die as a mouse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She turned into a mouse and then came back and was helped back out by your bird-cat! That's awesome!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you learn anything?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: There is a trap door. You can get through it, through a mess hall and through another room and a hallway. There are two Iron Shepherds eating in the mess hall. There are, I think, many under the trap door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Many?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Well, I saw beds. I saw six beds, plus a big bed. The big bed belongs to the leader.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What do you mean you don't know if you saw your son?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: He was eating something. I don't think it was him, but it looked like he was eating--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One of these in the mess hall?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No, just the leader that was eating something that didn't look like an animal. It looked small.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Jesus Christ.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Like my son's size.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many people? You said two?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: My son is not dead. He is there underneath the trap door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull some paper out and say, "Can you draw these rooms?"

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes, I will do my best.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll have an actual sketch for you next time.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We know that there are members of The Iron Shepherds here, and we know they have beds here. Wait until the fall of night?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Take out the guards, kill them in their sleep?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I still would like some help, maybe one extra hand.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How much time do we have until nightfall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Until nightfall? I'd say with the two-hours travel from the morning, you'd have probably another six seven hours.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long is it to travel to get back to town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you are heading straight south to the town, it's maybe another hour. Well, actually a little less than that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not as far as I thought.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I wish I knew if there was another entrance or exit underneath that trap door. I couldn't get in, but I heard the voices and I heard many people under there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I know anything from my time in the criminal underworld, it's these people always have secret passageways in and out. We could do like a wide walk of the perimeter, see if we find anything out-of-place in the forest. See if there's a path, and if we don't find anything, make our way back into town. Look for a hired hand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I like the idea of an extra hand or two to back us up, but I also agree with you. We go in at night and try to take the guards out, who are watching quietly, hopefully. If that is the case, we can go in and get our friends, and if we do that successfully, then we can burn these ones in their sleep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Again with the burning thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Write what you know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So. Let's search around and see if we can search the woods.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do a perimeter check?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Perimeter check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Looking for secret entrances!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. I will need both stealth checks from all of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Super stealth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stealthy searching!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm at disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're disadvantaged with your stealth check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I got a one, so there's not going to get much worse than that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing over, you immediately see that one guard that was shooting at Frumpkin go like, "Hey, hey hey hey!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispering) Hey, let's run back to town.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Run! Yeah run! We run back to town. Fuck the perimeter search.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heading southward to town or, where are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Southward to town.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Away directly from the building.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and you guys go running as fast as you can towards town.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry sorry sorry! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Charging through the Savalierwood to find what hopeful aid or fortune you can. And that's where we will end tonight's session.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good game.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Great game!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well done, guys.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I've already seen such scaring things!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. We will pick up on that next Thursday, with both Sumalee and Ashly.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Look who's here!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Look at this guy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Goddamn it, you people! Hi!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm Taliesin Jaffe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How was it from the lobby?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hi guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were you the little boy being eaten?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was, in fact, the bear. Thank you to all those that guessed. I was the bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Missed an opportunity.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah not yet, not yet! Ugh! Okay.

lines.name: MATT, TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe next week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway, thank you guys! Amazing job! Sumalee, amazing! (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, Nila!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you guys for coming along with us. For those of you who we will see at Comic-Con, we will see you there! If not, you will see our panel on Tuesday in place of Talks Machina, so you can get caught up. In the meantime, just know that we love you. Have a wonderful weekend, and is it Thursday yet? Good night! [music]
